data.title: Fix editor glitches when the mesh/material preview is shown
data.body: Closes #5878.

data.title: Better editor settings for the FileSystem dock
data.body:
I've made some changes to the FileSystem dock editor settings:
- All settings of the dock are in a new category("FileSystem dock"), instead of using the same settings of the file dialogs.
- Added `DisplayMode` enum to the `FileSystemDock` class(To use instead of `EditorFileDialog::DisplayMode`).
- New function `FileSystemDock::set_display_mode`, removed `FileSystemDock::set_use_thumbnails`.
- Save the current display mode when changing it from the dock(Closes #3496).

data.title: Running the game before saving issue
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When I run a scene that is not saved, it prompts me first to save the game. That is perfectly good. But after saving it forgets to call run. I have to press run by myself again to make it run. So I think the run function is not being called in that particular routine.

**Steps to reproduce:**
As stated above.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Texture import fails when source directory contains project name
data.body:
Windows 10 64bit
Godot 2.1 Stable

Texture import fails when the directory structure looks like this, with a project named _test_:
- gamedev
  - test
  - test_assets
    - untitled.png

Where the **test** folder contains the project, and the **test_assets** folder contains the texture.
Attempting to import **untitled.png** as any texture type with any settings will produce errors like the following:

Error opening file: res:/_assets/untitled.png

Where it seems _test_ in the source path (which should be _.../gamedev/test_assets/untitled.png_) has been mistakenly replaced with res:/, pointing it to the wrong place. This does not occur when the **test_assets** folder is not in the same directory as the project folder.

data.title: Compile Error on Windows & Linux (syntax error in object.h)
data.body:
Windows 10 Home - VS Community 2015 - Python 2.7.12 - scons 2.5.0 - godot master
Linux Debian 8.5 - i686-w64-mingw32-gcc (GCC) 4.9.1 - python 2.7.9 - scons 2.3.1

Windows:
C:\godot\core\object.h(329): error C2059: syntax error: 'constant'
C:\godot\core\object.h(332): error C2143: syntax error: missing ';' before '}'
...
....
...
scons: **\* [modules\enet\register_types.windows.tools.64.obj] Error 2
scons: building terminated because of errors.

Linux:
core/object.h:329:3: error: expected identifier before numeric constant
   CONNECT_DEFERRED=1,
   ^
core/object.h:329:3: error: expected '}' before numeric constant

Reproduce:
execute: c:\godot\scons platform=windows

data.title: Usability improvement in adding/setting groups
data.body:
If we have several nodes in the hierarchy, let's say 15 of them and we need to add them to a group, we need to type the group name 15 times and add them as one by one.

How about showing all groups in the project in the groups section as a checklist. This will not only make it adding faster but also make us know what groups are there project wide.

(I know that adding the root node to a group in a packedscene does the job, but I want the packedscene in different groups on different levels)

data.title: VideoPlayer doesnt't loop correctly
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Godot 2.1 stable official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
VideoPlayer doesn't have loop function and looping in GDScript gives 1-2 second delay between consecutive plays.

**Steps to reproduce:**

```
extends VideoPlayer

func _process(delta):
    if self.is_playing() == false:
        play()

func _ready():
    # Called every time the node is added to the scene.
    # Initialization here
    set_process(true)
```

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://godotengine.org/qa/888/cannot-get-a-video-to-loop-correctly

data.title: DampedSpringJoint2D.set_length() doesn't affect attached bodies
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OSX 10.10.3 Godot 2.1 stable official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I have two bodies (static and rigid) attached by a DampedSpringJoint2D node. When using GDScript I call set_length() with a different length or call set_rest_length() with a different rest length, the rigid body doesn't react at all. I expect that it would moves when any of the two lengths are modified on run time.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create two 2D bodies (static and rigid) and attach them with a DampedSpringJoint2D. Create one script to change the length or/and the rest length of the spring at run time.
Notice how the rigid body doesn't react at all.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[SpringTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/421982/SpringTest.zip)

Usage: 
Please be sure that Debug options has collision shapes visible.
Use up and down arrows to change spring length.

Script used:

```
extends DampedSpringJoint2D

var length=100
var new_length=100

var node_a_path
var node_b_path

func _ready():
    set_process_input(true)
    set_fixed_process(true)
    node_a_path=get_node_a()
    node_b_path=get_node_b()
    pass

func _fixed_process(delta):
    if length==new_length:
        return
    length=new_length
    set_node_a("")
    set_node_b("")

    set_rest_length(length)
    set_length(length)

    set_node_a(node_a_path)
    set_node_b(node_b_path)

    pass

func _input(event):
    if event.is_action_pressed("ui_up") and not event.is_echo():
        new_length+=10
    if event.is_action_pressed("ui_down") and not event.is_echo():
        new_length-=10
    pass
```

data.title: Add Threads for VS (Fork, Join and Mutex/Semaphore vs nodes)
data.body:
add Fork and Join nodes to visual script
- Fork - divides execution into multiple parallel threads (so **not sequence**)
- Join - joins threads (like posix pthread_join) - waits for all to complete
- Mutex/Semaphore - like thread mutex/semaphore

example:
![example_fork_join](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/959429/17727878/619b98f8-645c-11e6-8329-69528e79412c.png)

@reduz

data.body:
add Constructor node to Visual Script, that will allow to construct basic types

example usage:
![example_constructor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/959429/17727717/808de7da-645b-11e6-80e1-5ed7cabffd54.png)

@reduz

data.title: Ability to set custom shortcut keys for Animation Editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS X 10.11.6 - Godot V2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I want to use shortcut keys for the animation editor.  To go forward frame by frame.  Currently these are ctrl + left arrow and ctrl + right arrow.  The problem is, that is also the OS X shortcut keys to move between desktops.  I'd like to request we can choose custom keys for the animation editor frame by frame movement so we don't interfere with the default OS X keys.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Load up OS X, multi desktop and press ctrl + left arrow and ctrl + right arrow

Thank you....

data.title: Line Edit text sometimes selects more than intended
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** 2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When highlighting text in a **Line Edit node**, sometimes the highlighted text that gets selected selects more than what you are trying to select.

Example:
![](https://i.gyazo.com/6e4120ec8b9763639f1bd0ae3c89c88d.gif)

Font style seems irrelevant, tested it without my custom font still happening.  Doesn't happen for Text Edit nodes though (so if anyone is having a problem with this now, can probably resize a text edit node for a temporary fix)

data.title: AnimationPlayer does not play the last index in spritesheet
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** 2.1 stable

![torch2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10387670/17704401/d2c17620-6389-11e6-9b46-6a761381ee90.png)

1) Add a sprite  and animation player node

2) Set the sprite to `8 vFrames`, and `2 HFrames`

3) Key frame the sprite's frame from 0 to 15

4) Set animation to `continuous mode`

As you see, once you start to animate with this sprite sheet is never shows the last frame index with the purple `L` written on it. 

Also, if you change the steps to zero it doesn't even go to frame `15` that you keyframed.. it goes back to `14` and then it goes to `0` before looping.  

https://i.gyazo.com/04a85fe532082738278270f473ead24a.gif

Windows 2.1 stable Official (steam)

When using the viewport on a panel, if you drag the editors viewport to the left, the in scene viewport floats over the right side controls, If you drag to the right, the in scene viewport floats underneath the left side controls.

data.title: Decouple server classes from Main and MainLoop classes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 x64 - Godot 2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
We discussed this today on #godotengine-devel with @bojidar-bg in regards to the possibility of introducing custom server implementations via the custom module mechanism.

It would be good to decouple existing server classes (e.g. Physics) from the Main classes and in the process enable developers to register their own servers via custom modules.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Check the source code.

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/9397458cc0a37f4899a0dba5352a6e045ed123d8/main/main.cpp#L1580
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp#L857

data.title: Dropped VS node goes to the visual scripting board's center instead of mouse cursor position
data.body:
Linux Mint 64bit MATE 17.3 
Godot version: 2.2 alpha (Aug 14th) 3db36684b183adbec93cce9fe91182186e389e06

When I drag from the "Available Nodes:" section and release my mouse, the visual node appears under my cursor, but as soon as I move it, it goes to the center of the board. This is unexpected behavior as it should follow directly under the cursor instead of going off screen as soon as it's movable.

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jUHMtXavsmA

data.title: Ability to modify Animation player in inherited scenes.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
It's little limited that there is no way to modify animations in inherited scenes. Especially that scene inheritance is often used when importing models from blender. We discuss this with reduzio on irc and here a solution proposed by him:

 _reduz_: As I mentioned before, the easy way would be, in the new animation dialog, an option to make it an "extension" animation, where you can choose an existing one. The new one would have the tracks of the old animation in non-editable fashion, and allow you to add new ones to it which you can edit
 _reduz_:  both old and new will remain there, but you will likely use the new one
 _reduz_: if the base one is modified, the new one simply appends it's tracks.
 _reduz_: this could be used in other situations too, i found often that I want to make two animations similar but with some modification (ie, for two enemies, even in 2D)

**But don't think this would solve all the problems, take a look at usecase below.**

data.title: Zoom visual script editor via mouse scrolling
data.body:
Linux Mint 17.3 - Godot version: 2.2 alpha (Aug 14th)

This is a feature request for the visual scripting system: the mouse scroll wheel will increase the zoom level as it is scrolled forward. When scrolled backward it should zoom out at the same rate. Would that not be ideal? It currently does nothing and it's what I expected it to do when I first tried it out. Thanks!

data.title: Is GLU a required dependency?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
godot master (2.1)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Within [drivers/gl_context/glew.h](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/drivers/gl_context/GL/glew.h#L1186) glu.h is included. Godot is not linked to libGLU and removing `#include<GL/glu.h>` does not break the build.

Is glu.h/libGLU required (or planned) to build godot properly or can this dependency be removed?

- `EditorPlugin::get_window_layout`
- `EditorPlugin::set_window_layout`

- `EditorPlugin::save_external_data`

Not entirely sure how osx was building it without this.

data.title: Add Node2d global rot/rotd/scale methods
data.body:
This PR is related to issue #6148.
It implement in Node2D the following methods:
- set_global_rot
- get_global_rot
- set_global_rotd
- get_global_rotd
- set_global_scale
- get_global_scale

I didn't see any clear place where to add tests, is there a policy on this ?

data.title: Matrix32 scale methods use Vector2 instead of Size2
data.body:
[`Matrix32` scale related methods](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/math/math_2d.h#L587) use `Vector2`, for example:

``` cpp
Vector2 get_scale() const;
```

However most of the work involving scaling works with the `Size2` type (i.g. [Matrix32::set_rotation_and_scale](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/math/math_2d.h#L577), [Node2d's stuff](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/2d/node_2d.h#L40) etc.)

This is not a big deal given `Scale2` is just a typedef of `Vector2`. However it would be more consistent to fix this ;-)

data.title: Split third party libraries in their own folder, with unmodified upstream versions
data.body:
As mentioned in 3db3668 and listed in #5248, we currently bundled external libraries / third party code in various locations: `core/`, `drivers/`, `modules/`, `platform/`, `scene/`, `servers/` (code snippets that we arguably "upstreamed") `tools/`.

This is messy and makes it very hard to keep track of the current versions we're using, whether we patched them, whether we can safely update them to the latest upstream version or if the engine will blow up, etc.

This also makes it practically impossible for us to be packaged for major Linux distros like Fedora or Debian which have very strong requirements on the stuff they package. If they need to write 15 patches to unbundle our libraries and use the system ones, they'll likely just give up.

Sanitising all this would also make it clearer what is covered by our MIT license and copyright and what is not. Many of the permissive licenses of those libraries (especially BSD-like) _require_ use to credit and mention the upstream project and license when using the source in binary form... which we obviously don't do so far, and Godot users even less.

---

My proposal would be to move all external libraries to a `thirdparty`, `external` or `libs` folder (cast your votes :)). Those libraries would be unmodified upstream versions as far as possible (if modified, this would have to be properly documented for each library).

The Godot-specific code for which these libraries are needed should be left out of this folder and kept in the relevant locations, e.g. `drivers/`. To give an example, `drivers/openssl` contains Godot-specific code to make use of OpenSSL features, whether builtin or shared, so this is good (apart from the cURL snippet ;)). `drivers/builtin_openssl2` contains the pristine upstream source code + our SCsub to build it, and should be moved to `thirdparty/openssl`.

Ideally, one should be able to build Godot after `rm -rf thirdparty` provided that all development headers are installed on the system and that no `=builtin` option was passed to the buildsystem.
